text:
My previous role used Wordpress and my current role uses webflow. 

Web flow has two user types (generally): designer, which is for building the site and editor, which is for just editing copy and images  (including meta, alts, etc). Editor on webflow makes it very easy to publish blogs of the designer has set it up well. I haven’t had any qualms with the actually writing and publishing on webflow. We have 100+ blog posts and I haven’t ran into any issues besides pagination (which is a separate issue I could speak to).

Wordpress is your tried and true. You can include yoast for basic seo help which isn’t available in webflow (but how much help does yoast really provide beyond the basics?) 

Overall I’d say it has less to do with seo and more to do with how proficient you are at building the website itself. webflow has a steeper learning curve while Wordpress can be overwhelming with plugins. If you have a designer that knows all this all you have to worry about it what’s easier to work with as a team.
